content.description: This is the route to the right of the 3 routes listed in this area. A hard move leads to easier climbing and the anchors.
content.location: Left of center among the wall.   Ring anchors are easy to spot.

content.description:
Start below the fine right to left leaning crack.

Climb directly up the small to large hands slitter passing the small overlap at 2/3 height.
content.protection:
Trad rack.

Double Rings bolted anchor

climbs.name: Honeymoon's Over
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron and Justin Colville, 27th May 2012

content.description:
Start on the far left end of the buttress below the steep exfoliating face.

With hands on a good small crimp make a hard sequence of moves up to a positive flake high on the right.    With the flake at hand continue to the good hueco and the first bold.

The opening moves are bouldery and the first bold fairly high so you may want to stick clip this bolt.

Continue from the first bolt up the good lieback crack then up onto the hanging slab.

Continue directly up the slab following the line of bolts all the way to the anchors.

climbs.name: Domestic Bliss
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron, Justin Colville, Ramey Adams, 27th May 2012

content.description:
Start to the left of the hand crack.

Climb up to the first bolt, and continue up the right facing groove until possible to move out left onto the slab.   Continue up the slab with an interesting crux above the 5th bolt.

Move left to reach the last bolt then directly up to the anchors.
